name: La Quinta Inn & Suites South Padre Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most important part of a beach vacation is location and the La Quinta does have that. Its end location provided a level of privacy not found at some of the other beach locations. However, and this is a big however, the location does not mediate their customer service--the worst I have ever experienced on SPI, even worse than the mediocre level of customer service found at your typical La Quinta. This property advertises itself as a “resort”…beach location, free breakfast, and a cheap beer box wine “happy hour” does not a resort make. The only beach service which the city of SPI allows to service the La Quinta due to a new beach permit policy elected to stop providing service because of the “slow” season. We had to resort to having a beach service provide us umbrella and chairs if front of an adjoining hotel approximately 200 yards away. The hotel staff was not even aware of how guest could get beach equipment and they weren’t aware that the service had stopped. When I advised the on-duty manager about this she said, “Oh, that might be a problem, I don’t know if we’ll be able to fix that.” Well, I can fix it—book at the Sheraton!
reviews.title: Location great, service mediocre

reviews.text: The Laquinta South Padre Island "Resort" advertises itself as a new hotel - new maybe a couple of years ago, but it is clearly showing it's age. It is important to acknowledge that a hotel on the beach can get some heavy use, and this is probably the case with this hotel, but it is not NEW so don't expect it. In addition, some shoddy construction detracts from the overall feel (minor point).
reviews.title: Overrated -however worth a second stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pro's- and there are quite a few -- right on the beach, balcony's with gulf view, nice sized rooms (we had 2 queen beds with sofa) fridge and micro, nice breakfast area.
reviews.title: Bring your dog(s) and your barbecue!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Con's --none really except as mentioned above.
reviews.title: Had a good time!

likes.liked: — Amazing view and great beach access.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Note about the gulf view rooms - we considered it, boy are we glad we didn't pay the extra $$ - it is a pool view/cabana room more than a gulf view , and the pool area was very noisy while we were there - we think the standard rooms were just fine.
reviews.title: Great Vacation Place

reviews.text: This hotel is right on the beach, and is probably the most affordable “new” property on the island. I think the hotel is less than 2 years old. Walking distance to the beach is very easy and short, compared with other hotels. The service is horrible hands down. The front desk staff is not very nice or attentive and always came off as bothered probably because they are always trying to solve management and facility problems (more on that later in the review). Overall this is a hit or miss place and I would probably not stay here again, as the Radisson or Sheraton are your better options.
reviews.title: Hit or Miss there are better options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Facility in general:
reviews.title: First time to visit this area
Memorial Day Week
reviews.text: Although new, the developer definitely cheeped out with the quality of construction, which has lead to many problems and maintenance nightmares. There are two VERY VERY slow hydraulic elevators. The center elevator also serves as the house-keeping elevator so you stop at every floor to let a staff person in thru the back elevator door. The one on the east end is quicker because it is only used by the guests. There are icemakers on all four floors, but only one was working at the time, and was usually empty. Washing machines were broken on the third floor and 4th floor hallway AC was out of order and HOT. Parking is difficult and although there is a large long parking lot, when the hotel is full you have to park in the fire lane. The parking lot is very long making your haul to the room very cumbersome, although they do have a golf cart to shuttle people to and from the front door. The breakfast area is spacious and has an okay offering of foods. I would recommend getting there before 9:00 as this seems to be the busy time and all tables are taken, even the overflow spaces.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms:
reviews.title: Enjoyable La Quinta

likes.liked: — The clean beach and romantic setting.

reviews.text: The rooms were nice in appearance mostly because they are new. Try and request a room on the north side of the building as these rooms have way better views of the ocean. I originally started out on the south side of the building, which overlooks a 1960’s nasty looking building. I was then moved to a room on the north side which had great views. The balconies are very shallow and hard to navigate. Each balcony has 2 cheap plastic chairs which had broken backs. The balcony doors are hard to lock, mostly because the strike plates are rusted and the doors are cheap. The beds are horrible and flatten to 1/3 their original size when you lay down. The pillows are cheap and provide no support and in my opinion need to be replaced. During my first night the AC system was leaking condensate water onto the floor and it smelled like dank mold, fortunately I was moved then next day. Also 3 light bulbs were out and this made the room dark at night. Being there with two other families they had similar problems with their rooms; broken patio chairs, ceiling fan did not work at all, phones did not work, sink drain stopped up. This place really needs a maintenance overhaul if you know what I mean.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: We were registered for a conference that was going to be held at the LaQuinta. We normally stay at the Holliday inn but since our conference was at LaQuinta we decided to give it a try. When we arived we were so impressed with not only the size of the rooms but how clean they were. Everyone was very friendly and made us feel right at home. We could not beleive how close we were to the beach. It was so close that my mother who is in a wheel chair and could never get to the beach at ht Holliday Inn had no problems at LaQuinta. We have found our new home on South Padre Island.
reviews.title: Pleasant Suprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sincerely,
reviews.title: Wow Wow Wow Wow

likes.liked: — Beach right outside of our room

reviews.title: Doubt if there will be a return trip
reviews.text: Mr. Hoover

We were so impressed with how clean and friendly the staff and management was. We did not expect to be so close to the beach, we were litterally 100 feet away from the water. The happy hour was nice with the free drinks and free nachos. We have found our new home away from home on South Padre Island.
reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this Dump

reviews.text: Stayed at this property a few months ago and what a difference a few months can make. The hotel is probably not more than three years old but you would never know it. Very worn down and not kept up. Loose bricks in the walkway, filthy, filthy pool, dirty carpet. If you want a place that is right on the beach, this place is for you. But if you want a clean, well-maintained hotel, go somewhere else.
reviews.title: poor management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This motel was on the beach, spacious rooms and clean.. Looks to be a pretty new motel. Its on the far end of the island so has more room to walk the beach without being crowded by the other motels. Yet you can drive in to restaurants easily in a few minutes. (Its a small island). Happy hour is OK, don't stay here for that reason. Its a couple of beers or boxed wine, but still fun. Breakfast is decent, the usual you might find at most motels providing them. Overall, I felt this was great value and I'd definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Very Nice.

likes.liked: — Large, clean rooms and right on the beach.

reviews.title: don't visit south padre island during spring break unless you are under 26!
reviews.text: I've stayed at LaQuinta Hotel several times in the last 4 years and it is a wonderful hotel, great value, great service, beautiful beach front and pool. There can be issues with parking, but thats common in alot of hotels.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not recommend visiting during spring break to any of the hotels on the Island, unless You are a college student and want the wild and craziness that goes on during spring break. Its not a time to relax and have quiet walks on the beach. That would be after spring break! (ask any local) There is a huge difference!
reviews.title: NEVER AGAIN WILL WE STAY HERE

likes.liked: — only that it was close to the convention center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its a wonderful place give it a second chance, because I'm hooked!
reviews.title: LaQuinta was great!
The La Quinta was good for us.
reviews.text: We usually stay at the Sheraton, (which I highly recommend),

aka: La Quinta Inn And Suites South Padre Hotel South Padre Island
description: La Quinta Inn & Suites is a Texas Beach hotel located on the north beach on South Padre Island. Hotel is located directly on the beach, featuring an ocean-side swimming pool, restaurant and bar. Enjoy free wireless high speed internet in your room, throughout the hotel, and outside to the pool and beach! Free bright side breakfast every morning featuring fresh Belgian waffles and a made-to-order omelet station. Host events for up to 200 people in our grand ballroom.
